poem:
Title: Beneath the Gavel's Weight

In the court's stern gaze, time constricts, ebbs,
Two fated decades draped in dewy disbelief.
Peterson now threads Hope's slender webs,
From death's tight grip, seeks fragile relief.

Los Angeles echoes his weary song,
Of innocence etched in trials unfair,
And Justice wakes, it may have been wrong,
In the morning light of a newfound prayer.
